00072 #include <string.h>
00073 #include <arpa/inet.h>
00074 #include <sys/confnet.h>
00075 #include <dev/nvmem.h>
00076 
00081 
00088 CONFNET confnet;
00089 
00102 int NutNetLoadConfig(CONST char *name)
00103 {
00104 #ifndef __NUT_EMULATION__   
00105     if (NutNvMemLoad(CONFNET_EE_OFFSET, &confnet, sizeof(CONFNET))) {
00106         return -1;
00107     }
00108     if (confnet.cd_size == sizeof(CONFNET) && strcmp(confnet.cd_name, name) == 0) {
00109         return 0;
00110     }
00111 #endif
00112     memset(&confnet, 0, sizeof(confnet));
00113 
00114     /*
00115      * Set initial MAC address to broadcast. Thanks to Tomohiro
00116      * Haraikawa, who pointed out that all zeroes is occupied by
00117      * Xerox and should not be used.
00118      */
00119     memset(confnet.cdn_mac, 0xFF, sizeof(confnet.cdn_mac));
00120 
00121     return -1;
00122 }
00123 
00129 int NutNetSaveConfig(void)
00130 {
00131 #ifndef __NUT_EMULATION__   
00132     confnet.cd_size = sizeof(CONFNET);
00133     if (NutNvMemSave(CONFNET_EE_OFFSET, &confnet, sizeof(CONFNET))) {
00134         return -1;
00135     }
00136 #endif
00137     return 0;
00138 }
